intro: Cleistanthus bakonensis, commonly known as the Bakonens Wild Olive, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant yellow flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
